item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installation We won’t cover further details how to properly setup Prometheus itself, we will only cover some basic setup based on docker-compose. But if you want to run this service discovery without docker-compose you should be able to adopt that to your needs. First of all we need to prepare a configuration for Prometheus that includes the service discovery which simply maps to a node exporter. global:scrape_interval:1mscrape_timeout:10sevaluation_interval:1mscrape_configs:- job_name:nodefile_sd_configs:- files:["/etc/sd/scw.json"]relabel_configs:- source_labels:[__meta_scaleway_public_ipv4]replacement:"${1}:9100"target_label:__address__- source_labels:[__meta_scaleway_zone]target_label:datacenter- source_labels:[__meta_scaleway_name]target_label:instance- job_name:scw-sdstatic_configs:- targets:- scw-sd:9000 After preparing the configuration we need to create the docker-compose.

item.title: Building
item.description: As this project is built with Go you need to install Go first. The installation of Go is out of the scope of this document, please follow the official documentation. After the installation of Go you need to get the sources: git clone https://github.com/promhippie/prometheus-scw-sd.git cd prometheus-scw-sd/ All required tool besides Go itself are bundled by Go modules, all you need is part of the Makfile: make generate build Finally you should have the binary within the bin/ folder now, give it a try with .
